item.title: Mohammed Siraj riles up Gabba crowd, Australia with 'bail flip', Marnus Labuschagne responds - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Mohammed Siraj riles up Gabba crowd, Australia with 'bail flip', Marnus Labuschagne responds - Watch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Mohammed Siraj continued his lively antics during the Border Gavaskar Trophy, notably at the Gabba, where he engaged the crowd and fellow cricketer Marnus Labuschagne with a 'bail flip' moment.

  • On Day 2 of the Brisbane Test, Siraj flipped the bails at the striker's end to unnerve Labuschagne.
  • Labuschagne responded by flipping the bails back, much to the cheers of the crowd.
  • This playful exchange came after a previous incident between the two during the Adelaide Test.
  • Siraj received boos from the crowd upon his arrival to bowl at the Gabba after a tumultuous outing in Adelaide.
  • In a prior match, both Siraj and Labuschagne faced penalties for their heated exchanges on the field.
“Siraj later gave a fiery send-off to local boy Travis Head after dismissing him, which led to recurring boos from the crowd.”

This latest incident adds to the ongoing rivalry and drama between the players and highlights the spirited environment of international cricket.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Live Score: Siraj walks off injured, body blow for IND after Marnus wicket - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Live Score: Fiery IND bowlers win opening session; Siraj dives around after injury scare

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

India's bowlers had a fiery start in the opening session of Day 2 against Australia, reducing the hosts to 104/3 by lunch. Mohammed Siraj faced an injury scare but returned to the field.

  • Australia was at 104/3 at lunch with Steve Smith (25*) and Travis Head (20*) at the crease.
  • Jasprit Bumrah took two wickets while Nitish Reddy claimed Marnus Labuschagne's wicket.
  • Mohammed Siraj left the field due to discomfort in his left leg but later returned.
  • The Indian bowling attack troubled Australia with early breakthroughs, establishing an advantage.
"There's a lot of grass and it looks a little soft as well so we want to try and make the best use of the conditions and try and see what we can do with the ball up front." - Rohit Sharma

India aims to capitalize on the initial success in order to challenge Australia's batting as the match unfolds.

item.title: Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch.

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Singer Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert in Chandigarh to newly crowned chess world champion Gukesh D. He praised Allu Arjun's film Pushpa and shared his thoughts on both topics during the performance.

  • Diljit dedicated his Chandigarh concert to Gukesh, encouraging attendees with a motivational message.
  • Gukesh D. recently became the youngest FIDE World Champion after defeating China's Ding Liren.
  • Diljit watched Pushpa: The Rise but not its sequel, Pushpa 2: The Rule, and praised the film.
  • Pushpa 2 has become the highest-grossing Indian film of 2024, earning ₹1100 crore within nine days of its release.
  • Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann's wife attended the concert; an advisory was issued to avoid alcohol-themed songs during the performance.
"Today's show is dedicated to world chess champion Gukesh. Do you know why it is dedicated to him? Because whatever you think in life, he has already thought about becoming a world champion. And he became that. Problems are there, I face them daily."

Overall, Diljit Dosanjh's concert highlighted both his admiration for Gukesh's achievements in chess and his appreciation for the film Pushpa, engaging the audience with inspirational messages and entertainment.

item.description:
Player Ratings: Rayo Vallecano 3 - 3 Real Madrid; 2024 La Liga

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Not specified

In an exciting La Liga match, Rayo Vallecano and Real Madrid ended in a thrilling 3-3 draw, showcasing significant performances from both teams.

  • Thibaut Courtois: Rating - 5; improvement needed in positioning.
  • Lucas Vazquez: Rating - 3; struggled defensively.
  • Tchouameni: Rating - 5.5; strong in duels but can disrupt team shape.
  • Rudiger: Rating - 4; fell asleep during crucial moments.
  • Fran Garcia: Rating - 5; struggled against Rayo's opening goal.
  • Luka Modric: Rating - 5; showed some good passing but lacked control.
  • Fede Valverde: Rating - 7; scored a brilliant goal.
  • Arda Guler: Rating - 7; contributed two assists and made vital defensive plays.
  • Jude Bellingham: Rating - 8.5; scored his seventh consecutive goal and equalized before halftime.
  • Brahim: Rating - 6; displayed good moments but lacked involvement.
  • Rodrygo: Rating - 8.5; key assists and goal contributor.
“Real Madrid’s best player once again — came up big with a seventh consecutive goal in all competitions.”

In summary, the match highlighted individual brilliance and team effort, key for both sides as they continue in the league.

item.title: "Do Mongrels Simply Purr?": Sunil Gavaskar Hits Back At Australia Crowd Booing Mohammed Siraj - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Do Mongrels Simply Purr?": Sunil Gavaskar Hits Back At Australia Crowd Booing Mohammed Siraj

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

Former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar criticized Australian fans and players for their treatment of Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj after a controversial incident during the second Test in Adelaide.

  • Gavaskar condemned the hypocrisy of Australian fans, suggesting they would cheer if the roles were reversed.
  • Siraj faced criticism for a fiery send-off directed at Australian batsman Travis Head, which Gavaskar believes was unjust.
  • Despite receiving a demerit point and a 20% fine on his match fees, Gavaskar noted the importance of the Indian Premier League in reducing animosity in cricket.
  • Gavaskar humorously questioned whether Australian cricketers are "mongrels" who only bark in the context of aggressive play.
"Siraj is getting the stick from all the 'saints' in Australian cricket who, of course, were known for their impeccable behaviour on the field... So, do mongrels simply purr, or do they bark, too?" - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's remarks highlight the double standards in cricket fan culture and emphasize a call for fair treatment of players regardless of nationality.

item.title: IND vs AUS: India release travelling reserves Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar and Navdeep Saini - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS: India release travelling reserves Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar and Navdeep Saini

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: Times of India

BRISBANE: The Indian cricket team has decided to release travelling reserves Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar, and Navdeep Saini, allowing them to participate in the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy starting December 21.

  • Yash Dayal, Mukesh Kumar, and Navdeep Saini are released to gain game time before the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • The trio has been with the Indian squad for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Only two Tests remain after the Brisbane fixture, with the next matches in Melbourne and Sydney.
  • Mukesh Kumar has been on an extended trip, traveling with the India A squad before the main series.
  • Saini played one India A fixture and has been training since.
  • Yash Dayal has already returned home to prepare for the tournament for Uttar Pradesh.
"We will treat it as a three-match Test series." - Shubman Gill

In conclusion, the decision to release these players highlights India's focus on ensuring that they get valuable playing time in domestic competitions as they prepare for future challenges.

item.title: ‘I think we all know…’: D Gukesh clarifies if he meant to publicly call out Magnus Carlsen to a championship challenge - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘I think we all know…’: D Gukesh clarifies if he meant to publicly call out Magnus Carlsen to a championship challenge

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

D Gukesh has made headlines after becoming the youngest world chess champion. Following his victory over Ding Liren, he expressed a desire to challenge Magnus Carlsen for a match, sparking discussions in the chess community.

  • D Gukesh defeated China's Ding Liren in Game 14 to become the youngest world chess champion at age 18.
  • Despite his win, Gukesh stated he doesn't consider himself the best player, acknowledging Magnus Carlsen's status.
  • Gukesh expressed a wish to compete against Carlsen, calling it an amazing opportunity and the toughest challenge in chess.
  • Carlsen responded to Gukesh's comments, indicating he is not interested in returning to competitive play.
  • Gukesh acknowledged Carlsen's previous statements about not enjoying the championship process but remains hopeful for a match.
“Winning World Chess Championship does not mean I am the best player, obviously that is Magnus Carlsen. I want to reach the level Magnus has achieved.”
“It will be, first and most importantly the biggest challenge that I can possibly face as a chess fan and as a chess player who wants to improve himself. I would love it if Magnus comes back, he is clearly the best and probably the greatest of all time.”

D Gukesh's historic win and his remarks about Magnus Carlsen have ignited interest in the chess world, leaving fans curious about the possible return of Carlsen to the championship scene.

item.title: Immediate Reaction: Rayo Vallecano 3-3 Real Madrid - Managing Madrid
item.description:
Immediate Reaction: Rayo Vallecano 3-3 Real Madrid

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Managing Madrid

Rayo Vallecano and Real Madrid played out a thrilling 3-3 draw in a local derby filled with excitement and key moments.

  • The game started with Rayo Vallecano taking the lead in the 4th minute followed by a second goal.
  • Real Madrid equalized before halftime with goals from Fede Valverde and Jude Bellingham.
  • Rodrygo Goes gave Madrid a brief lead in the second half, but Rayo equalized again to finish 3-3.
  • Vinícius Júnior's introduction added flair to Madrid's attack but couldn't change the outcome.

4'—Rayo Vallecano 1-0 Real Madrid
36'—Rayo Vallecano 2-0 Real Madrid
39'—Rayo Vallecano 2-1 Real Madrid
45'—Rayo Vallecano 2-2 Real Madrid
56'—Rayo Vallecano 2-3 Real Madrid
64'—Rayo Vallecano 3-3 Real Madrid

The match showcased the competitive spirit of both teams and left many questioning if this was a missed opportunity for Real Madrid in the title race.

item.title: Amidst Test recall jeopardy, Shami picked in Bengal's VHT squad - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Amidst Test recall jeopardy, Shami picked in Bengal's VHT squad

Published on: Sat, Dec 14, 2024, 06:28 PM | Source: Cricbuzz

Mohammed Shami has been included in the Bengal squad for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy despite ongoing uncertainties about his participation in the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Shami, along with Mukesh Kumar, is set to strengthen Bengal's bowling attack in the tournament starting on December 21.
  • There is speculation regarding Shami's inclusion in the Test squad for the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • After a lengthy injury hiatus, Shami successfully played in multiple T20 matches without setbacks.
  • The team management, including captain Rohit Sharma, emphasizes the need to be cautious with Shami's fitness before considering him for Test matches.
  • Bengal's campaign will kick off against Delhi in Hyderabad.
"We want to be very careful, we don't want to bring him here, he pulls up sore or something happens." - Rohit Sharma

The Bengal team looks forward to Shami's participation in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, while his Test future remains cautiously optimistic.

item.title: Omarzai and Rashid lead Afghanistan to T20I series win over sloppy Zimbabwe - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Omarzai and Rashid lead Afghanistan to T20I series win over sloppy Zimbabwe

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

Afghanistan secured a thrilling victory against Zimbabwe in the third T20I, successfully chasing down 128 runs to win the series, thanks to notable performances from Azmatullah Omarzai and Rashid Khan.

  • Afghanistan chased down a target of 128 after being 45 for 4 at one point.
  • Azmatullah Omarzai scored 34 runs, while Mohammad Nabi contributed with an unbeaten 24 runs.
  • Zimbabwe posted a total of 127 runs, with Brian Bennett scoring 31 runs, but they were hurt by giving away 17 extras.
  • Rashid Khan excelled with the ball, taking 4 wickets for 27 runs, dismantling Zimbabwe's middle order.
  • Zimbabwe has now lost all six bilateral T20I series against Afghanistan.
“Afghanistan hardly looked in trouble after Akram's over with five wides.”
“Brian Bennett ended as the highest run-getter across both sides with 107 runs in the series.”

The match showcased Afghanistan's resilience despite early setbacks, with standout performances from Omarzai and Nabi leading them to a historic series victory against Zimbabwe. This win reflects Afghanistan's growing prowess in T20 cricket.

item.title: "Cassata Today, Sundae Tomorrow": India's Team Selection In Gabba Test Slammed - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Cassata Today, Sundae Tomorrow": India's Team Selection In Gabba Test Slammed

Publication Date: October 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Former India opener Aakash Chopra criticizes Team India's selection process for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, highlighting the inconsistency in spinners chosen for the matches.

  • Aakash Chopra raised concerns over the frequent changes in the team's spinner, noting that different spinners have been selected for each Test.
  • Ravindra Jadeja was chosen as the sole spinner for the third Test in place of Ravichandran Ashwin.
  • Washington Sundar was the spinner for the first Test and was dropped despite India's success.
  • Chopra compared the selection inconsistency to changing food preferences, expressing the need for continuity in team selection.
"It seems they want to play a new spinner in every Test match. Washi played in the first, Ashwin played in the second, and Jadeja is playing in the third. Kuldeep might have played in the fourth had he been there."
"No one had done anything wrong. Neither did Washington Sundar do anything wrong in Perth nor did Ravichandran Ashwin do anything wrong in Adelaide."

As India prepares for the third Test at The Gabba, they hope to take the lead against Australia, though weather conditions may pose challenges.

item.description:
Sara Tendulkar breaks the internet by slaying at the Gabba with Zaheer Khan, Prachi Desai and Sagarika Ghatge

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: India.com

Sara Tendulkar captured the attention of social media with her stunning appearances at the Gabba alongside friends, including former cricketer Zaheer Khan and actress Prachi Desai.

  • Sara shared several pictures from her time at the Gabba.
  • She was seen smiling and enjoying her time with Zaheer Khan's wife, Sagarika Ghatge.
  • Sara is highly active on social media, boasting over 73 million followers on Instagram.
  • The event showcased her love for capturing memories and supporting Team India.
"Sara Tendulkar always supports Team India whether it's Test cricket, ODI format game or T20I game."

The event emphasized Sara's charm and popularity, highlighting her connections with notable personalities in the sports and entertainment world.

item.title: Mainz 1-0 Bayern Munich: Halftime observations - Bavarian Football Works
item.description:
Mainz 2-1 Bayern Munich: Initial reactions and Observations

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Bavarian Football Works

In a surprising turn of events, Bayern Munich suffered a 2-1 defeat against Mainz 05 in the Bundesliga, showcasing one of their poorest performances to date.

  • The match revealed major deficiencies in Bayern's play, particularly from key players such as Leroy Sane and Joshua Kimmich.
  • Jamal Musiala was noted as the only standout player, trying to make an impact amidst a lack of support.
  • Refereeing decisions came under scrutiny, with 33 fouls called and only four yellow cards issued.
  • Bayern is set to face Leipzig in their next match on December 20 or 21, marking the end of their year.
“That was one of the worst Bayern performances of late. How are you getting dominated by a team sitting in the middle of the table? Have some shame.”

The defeat raises concerns about Bayern's chances moving forward, especially with their form trailing ahead of the crucial upcoming fixture against Leipzig.

item.title: Virat Kohli reaches new milestone, joins Sachin Tendulkar in this elite list - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli reaches new milestone, joins Sachin Tendulkar in this elite list

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Virat Kohli has achieved a new milestone in his cricket career by becoming only the second player to feature in 100 or more international matches against Australia, a record that was previously held by Sachin Tendulkar.

  • Kohli has played 28 Tests, 49 ODIs, and 23 T20Is against Australia.
  • He has scored 5326 runs in 117 innings, with an average of 50.24, including 17 centuries and 27 half-centuries.
  • Sachin Tendulkar played 39 Tests and 71 ODIs against Australia, amassing 3630 runs in Tests and 3077 runs in ODIs.
  • Other notable players who have played over 80 matches against Australia include Desmond Haynes, MS Dhoni, and Vivian Richards.
“Records are meant to be broken when Virat Kohli steps onto the field.”

This achievement reinforces Kohli's status as one of the greats in cricket, continuing a legacy that includes legendary players like Sachin Tendulkar.

item.title: Ex-Pakistan Star's 'IPL' Dig As Jason Gillespie Resigns As Head Coach: "Just Make CVs..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ex-Pakistan Star's 'IPL' Dig As Jason Gillespie Resigns As Head Coach: "Just Make CVs..."

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Former cricketer Basit Ali has criticized Jason Gillespie following his resignation as Pakistan's head coach, suggesting that it was a calculated move to enhance his career prospects.

  • Jason Gillespie resigned after the PCB did not review Tim Nielsen's contract.
  • Gillespie's departure coincides with Pakistan's upcoming Test series against South Africa.
  • Basit Ali claims Gillespie's resignation helps him in building his CV.
  • He speculated that Gillespie and Nielsen would receive offers from IPL teams.
  • Basit humorously commented on the preference for foreign coaches in Pakistan.
"When Mickey Arthur was removed, people said that perhaps there would be no foreign coaches in Pakistan. Now, when these two have stepped down, you will see that they will get offers from other countries and franchises." - Basit Ali

In conclusion, Basit Ali's remarks highlight concerns over coaching transitions in Pakistan cricket and the perceived benefits foreign coaches enjoy, suggesting a potential trend of foreign expertise in leadership roles.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test, Day 2, Brisbane weather forecast: Will it rain once again at the Gabba? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test, Day 2, Brisbane weather forecast: Will it rain once again at the Gabba?

Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Day 1 of the ongoing third Test match between India and Australia was severely affected by rain, leading to only 13.2 overs being played. The forecast for Day 2 suggests further rain could disrupt play.

  • Day 1 was cut short at the Gabba, with only 13.2 overs played due to rain.
  • India's captain, Rohit Sharma, chose to bowl after winning the toss. The Australian openers ended the day unbeaten.
  • Weather forecast indicates cloudy conditions and showers expected from 9 AM local time, lasting for about two hours.
  • India has made changes to their lineup, including the inclusion of Ravindra Jadeja and Akash Deep.
  • The visitors recently lost to Australia by 10 wickets in Adelaide, leveling the series at 1-1.
"The temperature is expected to hover around 24-31 degrees Celsius on Day 2."

The ongoing weather conditions and previous performances underscore the challenges both teams face as they strive for momentum in this closely contested series.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Hourly Weather Report: Brisbane Under 'Alert'. The Reason Is... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Hourly Weather Report: Brisbane Under 'Alert'

Publication Date: December 24, 2024
Source: NDTV

Day 1 of the 3rd Test between India and Australia was heavily affected by rain, with only 13.2 overs played before the umpires called off play. The weather condition is expected to remain a concern on Day 2.

  • Day 1 saw Australia finishing at 28-0, with Khawaja 19 not out.
  • Rain interruptions led to a half-hour delay, impacting play significantly.
  • The Bureau of Meteorology issued a red alert for the region, warning of minor floods.
  • Forecast predicts a medium chance of showers throughout Day 2.
  • Play on Day 2 is set to start 30 minutes early, pending weather conditions.
"Partly cloudy. Medium chance of showers, most likely in the morning and afternoon." - Bureau of Meteorology

In conclusion, with adverse weather conditions continuing into Day 2, the match's progress remains uncertain, highlighting the challenges faced by both teams in adapting to the rain-affected play.

item.title: 'If I was him, I would have ...': Shoaib Akhtar's bold advice to Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
item.description:
'If I was him, I would have ...': Shoaib Akhtar's bold advice to Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has advised Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah to focus on shorter formats of cricket to manage his fitness better and prolong his career amid concerns over his injury history.

  • Akhtar suggests that Test cricket's physical demands may strain Bumrah's fitness, advising him to focus on shorter formats.
  • He highlights Bumrah's effectiveness in limited-overs cricket, particularly in death overs and powerplay situations.
  • With 185 wickets in 42 Tests, Akhtar believes Bumrah has the potential to be an elite fast bowler but warns of recurring injuries hindering his Test career.
  • He emphasizes the importance of increasing pace for success in Test cricket while acknowledging the risk of injury associated with it.
  • Akhtar stresses that Bumrah must consider his future, balancing responsibilities in IPL, ODIs, and Tests.
“If I was him, I would have stuck to shorter formats,” said Akhtar, pointing out the risks involved with Test cricket.

In conclusion, Akhtar's advice underscores the importance of managing physical strain for athletes, particularly in demanding sports like cricket, where longevity is crucial for success.
